model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: Well if you ever need someone to come and help for a couple of hours here and there, give me a call, you know how much I love to be in the library anyway

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker A is a retired librarian who enjoys implementing creative activities in their library.
2. Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park.
3. Speaker B likes the idea of making the fishing trip an annual tradition to get the grandkids more interested in nature.
4. Speaker A has kids and is busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like.
5. Speaker A and Speaker B agree on the importance of reading and the value of libraries, despite the rise of the internet.
6. Speaker A sees parents bringing in their little kids to the library as encouraging.
current_dialogue: Speaker B: Well if you ever need someone to come and help for a couple of hours here and there, give me a call, you know how much I love to be in the library anyway

raw_prediction: Thank you so much for the offer, that means a lot. Having your help at the library would truly make a difference, especially during these busy times. I will definitely keep that in mind and reach out when needed.
